project.name: Council
project.description: The elected Gentoo Council decides on global issues and policies that affect multiple projects in Gentoo.
project.longdescription: The elected Gentoo Council decides on global issues and policies that affect multiple projects in Gentoo. It also serves as an appeal court for displinary decisions. The Council members are elected for a year and must hold monthly public meetings. This form of management was created via GLEP 39.

body.p: Meetings are typically held on the 2nd Thursday of each month, at 1900 UTC (1400 EST) in the #gentoo-council irc channel on irc.freenode.net. They may be pushed back to 3rd Thursdays and/or to 2000 UTC as needed to accommodate council member availability.

body.p: To ensure that the council stays active, the chosen metastructure model says that if a council member (or their appointed proxy) fails to show up for two consecutive meetings, they are marked as a slacker.

If a council member who has been marked a slacker misses any further meeting (or their appointed proxy doesn't show up), they lose their position and a new election is held to replace that person. The 'slacker' marker is reset when a member is elected.
If any meeting has less than 50% attendance by council members, a new election for all places must be held within a month.

ul.li: Council elections generally happen once a year
The council is composed of seven elected members
Nominations are allowed from July 1st 0000 UTC to July 31st 2359 UTC
Only Gentoo developers may be nominated
Anyone can nominate (nominating yourself is OK)
Nominees must accept their nomination before voting begins
Voting is opened from August 1st 0000 UTC to August 31st 2359 UTC
Gentoo uses the Condorcet method of voting
